title: The Filter Forge
story: Filtering lets you select specific items from a collection based on criteria! Combined with list comprehensions or the filter() function, you can extract exactly the data you need. It's like panning for gold in a stream!
instructions: Create a list `numbers` from 1 to 20 (using range). Use list comprehension to create `divisible_by_3` with numbers divisible by 3. Create `greater_than_10` with numbers > 10. Print both filtered lists.
solutionHidden:
numbers = list(range(1, 21))
divisible_by_3 = [x for x in numbers if x % 3 == 0]
greater_than_10 = [x for x in numbers if x > 10]
print(divisible_by_3)
print(greater_than_10)

hints.text: Use list comprehension with if condition: [x for x in list if condition]
Check divisibility with modulo: x % 3 == 0. Check greater with: x > 10
